definition: to be in the way/to be a hindrance
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
foot/leg (of an animal or an object)/base (of an object)/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]/classifier for kicks

sentences.english: Children get in the way during in the holidays.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們在假日裏總是礙手礙腳的。

sentences.english: I don't want you kids under my feet while I'm cooking.
sentences.chinese: 我做飯時不希望你們這些孩子在我這兒礙手礙腳的。

sentences.english: On the other hand, conductors often aren't inspiring and just get in the way.
sentences.chinese: 此外，指揮們往往非但不能鼓舞人心，反而礙手礙腳。

sentences.english: I'm really busy – stop getting in the way.
sentences.chinese: 我正忙着呢，別在這裏礙手礙腳的。

sentences.english: Although he meant to help us prepare the dinner, he was only in the way.
sentences.chinese: 雖然他是想幫助我們準備晚餐，但他只是礙手礙腳。

sentences.english: Put this in the other room so as to keep it out of the way.
sentences.chinese: 把這東西放到另一間屋裏去，免得它在這裏礙手礙腳。

sentences.english: I'll stand this box in the corner; it will be out of the way there.
sentences.chinese: 我將把這個箱子豎放在角落裏，它就不會礙手礙腳了。
